Class CollectionUtils

extends Object
    Utility methods for collections.

      • addIfNotNull

        public static <T> List<T> addIfNotNull(List<T> l,
                                       T o)
        Add a value to a list if the value is not null.
        Parameters:
        l - The list to add to.
        o - The element to add.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • addReverse

        public static List<?> addReverse(List list,
                                 List append)
        Adds the contents of one list to the other in reverse order.

        i.e. add values from 2nd list from end-to-start order to the end of the 1st list.

        Parameters:
        list - The list to append to.
        append - Contains the values to append to the list.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • addReverse

        public static List<?> addReverse(List list,
                                 Object[] append)
        Adds the contents of the array to the list in reverse order.

        i.e. add values from the array from end-to-start order to the end of the list.

        Parameters:
        list - The list to append to.
        append - Contains the values to append to the list.
        Returns:
        The same list.

        reverse - If true, iterate in reverse order.

      • immutableMap

        Creates an immutable map from the specified map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to copy from.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable LinkedHashMap copy of the collection, or a Collections.emptyMap() if the collection was empty or null.

      • addToList

        public static <T> List<T> addToList(List<T> appendTo,
                                    Object[] values,
                                    Class<T> type,
                                    Type... args)
        Adds a set of values to an existing list.
        Parameters:
        appendTo - The list to append to.
        If null, a new ArrayList will be created.
        values - The values to add.
        type - The data type of the elements.
        args - The generic type arguments of the data type.
        Returns:
        The converted value, or null if the input was null.

      • addToMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> addToMap(Map<K,V> appendTo,
                                      Object[] values,
                                      Class<K> keyType,
                                      Class<V> valueType,
                                      Type... valueTypeArgs)
        Adds a set of values to an existing map.
        Parameters:
        appendTo - The map to append to.
        If null, a new LinkedHashMap will be created.
        values - The values to add.
        keyType - The data type of the keys.
        valueType - The data type of the values.
        valueTypeArgs - The generic type arguments of the data type of the values.
        Returns:
        The converted value, or null if the input was null.

        Returns:
        A new ArrayList, or null if the input was null.

      • addToList

        public static <T> List<T> addToList(List<T> l,
                                    Collection<T> val)
        Copies the specified values into an existing list.
        Parameters:
        l - The list to add to.
        If null, a new ArrayList will be created.
        val - The values to add.
        Returns:
        The list with values copied into it.

      • newMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> newMap(Map<K,V> val)
        Creates a new map from the specified map.
        Parameters:
        val - The value to copy from.
        Returns:
        A new LinkedHashMap, or null if the input was null.

      • addToMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> addToMap(Map<K,V> m,
                                      Map<K,V> val)
        Copies the specified values into an existing map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to add to.
        If null, a new LinkedHashMap will be created.
        val - The values to add.
        Returns:
        The list with values copied into it.

      • addToMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> addToMap(Map<K,V> m,
                                      K key,
                                      V value)
        Adds a single entry into an existing map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to add to.
        If null, a new LinkedHashMap will be created.
        key - The entry key.
        value - The entry value.
        Returns:
        The list with values copied into it.

      • newSortedMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> newSortedMap(Map<K,V> val,
                                          Comparator<K> comparator)
        Creates a new map from the specified map.
        Parameters:
        val - The value to copy from.
        comparator - The key comparator to use, or null to use natural ordering.
        Returns:
        A new LinkedHashMap, or null if the input was null.

      • newSortedCaseInsensitiveSet

        public static Set<String> newSortedCaseInsensitiveSet(String... values)
        Creates a case-insensitive ordered set out of the specified string values.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to populate the set with.
        Returns:
        A new ordered set.

      • newSortedCaseInsensitiveSet

        public static Set<String> newSortedCaseInsensitiveSet(String values)
        Creates a case-insensitive ordered set out of the specified string values.
        Parameters:
        values - A comma-delimited list of the values to populate the set with.
        Returns:
        A new ordered set.

      • newUnmodifiableSortedCaseInsensitiveSet

        public static Set<String> newUnmodifiableSortedCaseInsensitiveSet(String values)
        Same as newSortedCaseInsensitiveSet(String) but makes the set unmodifiable.
        Parameters:
        values - A comma-delimited list of the values to populate the set with.
        Returns:
        A new ordered set.

      • addToSortedMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> addToSortedMap(Map<K,V> m,
                                            Map<K,V> val,
                                            Comparator<K> comparator)
        Copies the specified values into an existing map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to add to.
        If null, a new LinkedHashMap will be created.
        val - The values to add.
        comparator - The key comparator to use, or null to use natural ordering.
        Returns:
        The list with values copied into it.

      • addToSortedMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> addToSortedMap(Map<K,V> m,
                                            K key,
                                            V value,
                                            Comparator<K> comparator)
        Adds a single entry into an existing map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to add to.
        If null, a new LinkedHashMap will be created.
        key - The entry key.
        value - The entry value.
        comparator - The key comparator to use, or null to use natural ordering.
        Returns:
        The list with values copied into it.

      • newUnmodifiableHashSet

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> Set<T> newUnmodifiableHashSet(T... values)
        Converts the specified arguments into an unmodifiable HashSet.
        Parameters:
        values - The entries to populate the hashset with.
        Returns:
        A new HashSet populated with the specified arguments.
